item.content:encoded:
This blog has been up for about two months (or about a year on Medium). I’m quite satisfied with what I’ve written so far, even though some of them have only 10 viewersðŸ˜….

As someone who constantly takes notes on almost everything I learn, I thought it would be fun to share these notes, particularly on IT/Cyber Security topics, on my blog, but I was wrong; it’s not as simple as I thought the first time. Converting those notes into a proper article structure has left me feeling overwhelmed, especially in the introduction section ðŸ˜….

And recently, I’ve had a few people reach me about featuring my article/post in their publication. I’m happy with that because my posts can reach a broader audience, but, at the same time, I have started to worry about my writing, especially the grammar.

To get over that insecurity, I had to review my post more than 2 times, check the sentence’s structure, translate it ID-EN, and other things that would make it look just right, at least for me. I know this would improve my English, but still, it’s not an easy task to do and it takes more time now to just write one post where I still have a lot of notes that I want to share, which keeps increasing day by day.

Not to mention that there are some untouched drafts in my Medium ðŸ˜….

After reflecting on my first objective of starting a blog and realizing that I’m an amateur writer who doesn’t aim for publication, but to share my notes and preserve my experiences, I decided to ‘ignore’ publication for now and start with something called a bite-sized post/article which is short and to-the-point post (CTF write-ups are excluded ðŸ˜‚).

With that I hope I could turn my notes into a blog post quickly without worrying too much about grammar.

Well, it’s not that I don’t need a publication; I’m totally fine increasing my audience from publication, which without a doubt motivates me to write more. But that’s not my priority right now, and, after all, I’m just an amateur who blogs as a hobby.
